availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Crawford (Montgomery County, Kentucky, lawyer and court clerk.)

body.p:
Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah Young Crawford in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1857. Father of Phoebe G. Crawford, Toliver Crawford, and Roy K. Crawford. Attorney in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850.
Household owned five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Clerk of the Montgomery Circuit Court in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 40B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 73A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, p. 311B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Montgomery County Marriages, Film 000273005, p. 635.
"James M. Crawford (1830-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial 84918233, accessed June 6, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84918233.
